isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 MODEL - CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING - Trailer Socket Wiring

entry.para: At trailer socket (577) and circuit 11P, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11P, then repair.
Remove trailer stop light relay (464-R10) and at circuit 70B, measure voltage to ground while an assistant applies service brakes.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70B from stop light switch (421), then repair.
At relay socket (464-R10) and circuit 70C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70C from 30A fuse F3-B, then repair.
At relay socket (464-R10) and circuit 70-G, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 70-G, 56-G, 11-GZ, or 11-GI to left cab ground (429), then repair.
Bench test trailer stop light relay (464-R10) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Replace defective trailer stop light relay (464-R10).
Bench test trailer stop light relay (464-R10) by applying +12V to terminal 86, ground to terminal 85, and measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Replace defective trailer stop light relay (464-R10).
Re-install trailer stop light relay and at trailer socket (577) and circuit 70C, measure voltage to ground while an assistant applies the service brake.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70C, connector (114)/(575), or circuit 70C, then repair.
Remove left turn relay (464-R11), and at circuit 56, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56 from 15A fuse F7-B, then repair.
Move turn signal switch to left turn position and at relay socket (464-R11) circuit 56A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56A, then repair.
Bench test left turn relay (464-R11) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench test left turn relay (464-R11) by applying +12V to terminal 86, ground to terminal 85, and measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Re-install left turn relay (464-R11), place turn signal switch in left turn position, and at trailer socket (577) and circuit 56D, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56D, connector (116)/(576), or circuit 56D, then repair.
Remove right turn relay (464-R12), and at circuit 57, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57 from 15A fuse F7-C, then repair.
Move turn signal switch to right turn position and at relay socket (464-R12) circuit 57A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57A, then repair.
Bench test right turn relay (464-R12) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench test right turn relay (464-R12) by applying +12V to terminal 86, ground to terminal 85, and measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Re-install right turn relay (464-R12), place turn signal switch in right turn position, and at trailer socket (577) and circuit 57D, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57D, connector (116)/(576), or circuit 57D, then repair.
Remove trailer ABS fuse F10-A (location may vary), and check for open condition.
Re-install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At ABS fuse F10-A (location may vary) and circuit 94AH, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 94AH from (B1) battery stud (779), then repair.
Remove trailer ABS relay (483), move key switch to ignition position, and at circuit 94AJ measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 94AJ from I1 ignition adapter (518), then repair.
At (483) measure voltage from circuit 97AJ to 94-GD.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 94-GD, then repair.
Bench test trailer ABS relay (483) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench test trailer ABS relay (483) by applying +12V to terminal 86, ground to terminal 85, and measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Re-install ABS relay (483), and move key switch to ignition position. At (577) circuit 94AF, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 94AF, connector (114)/(575), or circuit 94AF, then repair.
Remove trailer tail light relay (464-R9), and at circuit 68, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 68 from 30A fuse F3-C, then repair.
At relay socket (464-R9), measure voltage from circuit 68 to 58-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 58-G, 70-G, 56-G, 11-GZ, or 11-GI to left cab ground (429), then repair.
Move headlight switch to park light position and at relay socket (464-R9) circuit 58P, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58P from trailer lights switch (409), then repair.
Bench test trailer tail light relay (464-R9) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench test trailer tail light relay (464-R9) by applying +12V to terminal 86, ground to terminal 85, and measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Re-install trailer tail light relay (464-R9), place turn signal switch in left turn position, and at trailer socket (577) and circuit 68A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 68E, 68A, connector (114)/(575), or circuit 68A, then repair.
Remove trailer marker relay (463-R8), and at circuit 58D, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58D from 20A fuse F3-A, then repair.
At relay socket (463-R8), measure voltage from circuit 58D to 58-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 58-GA, 58-G, 70-G, 56-G, 11-GZ, or 11-GI to left cab ground (429), then repair.
Move headlight switch to park light position and at relay socket (463-R8) circuit 58C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58C, then repair.
Bench test trailer marker relay (463-R8) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench test trailer marker relay (463-R8) by applying +12V to terminal 86, ground to terminal 85, and measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Re-install trailer marker relay (463-R8), place headlight switch in park lights position, and at trailer socket (577) and circuit 58A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58A, connector (116)/(576), or circuit 58A, then repair.
At trailer socket (577) and circuit 11P, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11P, then repair.
Remove trailer stop light relay (464-R10) and at circuit 70B, measure voltage to ground while an assistant applies service brakes.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70B from stop light switch (421), then repair.
At relay socket (464-R10) and circuit 70C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70C from 30A fuse F3-B, then repair.
At relay socket (464-R10) and circuit 70-G, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 70-G, 56-G, 11-GZ, or 11-GI to left cab ground (429), then repair.
Bench test trailer stop light relay (464-R10) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Replace defective trailer stop light relay (464-R10).
Bench test trailer stop light relay (464-R10) by applying +12V to terminal 86, ground to terminal 85, and measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Replace defective trailer stop light relay (464-R10).
Re-install trailer stop light relay and at trailer socket (577) and circuit 70C, measure voltage to ground while an assistant applies the service brake.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70C, connector (114), or circuit 70C, connector (575) or circuit 70C, then repair.
Remove left turn relay (464-R11), and at circuit 56, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56 from 15A fuse F7-B, then repair.
Move turn signal switch to left turn position and at relay socket (464-R11) circuit 56A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56A, then repair.
Bench test left turn relay (464-R11) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench test left turn relay (464-R11) by applying +12V to terminal 86, ground to terminal 85, and measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Re-install left turn relay (464-R11), place turn signal switch in left turn position, and at trailer socket (577) and circuit 56D, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56D, connector (116) circuit 56D, connector (576) or, circuit 56D, then repair.
Remove right turn relay (464-R12), and at circuit 57, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57 from 15A fuse F7-C, then repair.
Move turn signal switch to right turn position and at relay socket (464-R12) circuit 57A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57A, then repair.
Bench test right turn relay (464-R12) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench test right turn relay (464-R12) by applying +12V to terminal 86, ground to terminal 85, and measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Re-install right turn relay (464-R12), place turn signal switch in right turn position, and at trailer socket (577) and circuit 57D, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57D, connector (116), circuit 57D, connector (576) or circuit 57D, then repair.
Remove trailer ABS fuse F10-A (location may vary), and check for open condition.
Re-install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At ABS fuse F10-A (location may vary) and circuit 94AH, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 94AH from (B1) battery stud (779), then repair.
Remove trailer ABS relay (483), move key switch to ignition position, and at circuit 94AJ measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 94AJ from I1 ignition adapter (518), then repair.
At (483) measure voltage from circuit 97AJ to 94-GD.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 94-GD, then repair.
Bench test trailer ABS relay (483) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench test trailer ABS relay (483) by applying +12V to terminal 86, ground to terminal 85, and measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Re-install ABS relay (483), and move key switch to ignition position. At (577) circuit 94AF, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 94AF, connector (114), circuit 94AF, connector (575), or circuit 94AF, then repair.
Remove trailer tail light relay (464-R9), and at circuit 68, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 68 from 30A fuse F3-C, then repair.
At relay socket (464-R9), measure voltage from circuit 68 to 58-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 58-G, 70-G, 56-G, 11-GZ, or 11-GI to left cab ground (429), then repair.
Move headlight switch to park light position and at relay socket (464-R9) circuit 58P, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58P from trailer lights switch (409), then repair.
Bench test trailer tail light relay (464-R9) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench test trailer tail light relay (464-R9) by applying +12V to terminal 86, ground to terminal 85, and measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Re-install trailer tail light relay (464-R9), place turn signal switch in left turn position, and at trailer socket (577) and circuit 68A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 68E, 68A, connector (114), circuit 68A, connector (575), or circuit 68A, then repair.
Remove trailer marker relay (463-R8), and at circuit 58D, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58D from 20A fuse F3-A, then repair.
At relay socket (463-R8), measure voltage from circuit 58D to 58-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 58-GA, 58-G, 70-G, 56-G, 11-GZ, or 11-GI to left cab ground (429), then repair.
Move headlight switch to park light position and at relay socket (463-R8) circuit 58C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58C, then repair.
Bench test trailer marker relay (463-R8) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench test trailer marker relay (463-R8) by applying +12V to terminal 86, ground to terminal 85, and measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Re-install trailer marker relay (463-R8), place headlight switch in park lights position, and at trailer socket (577) and circuit 58A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58A, connector (116), circuit 58A, connector (576), or circuit 58A, then repair.
